title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3: OUT OF SCHOOL CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2020, formal and informal structures of general, technical and vocational training have strengthened capacity to enhance enrolment and reintegrate out-of-school children aged 3-16 years., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children aged 3 to 16, especially girls from the most disadvantaged regions, have increased and equitable access to quality early childhood development and gender responsive basic education services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, formal and informal structures of general, technical and vocational training have strengthened capacity to enhanceenrolment and reintegrate out-of-school children aged 3-16 years.

description.narrative: In line with the Key Results for Children in West and Central Africa (KRC), particularly KRC 3, the Country Office supported three initiatives: 1) community pre-school centres; 2) the integration of children from Islamic education structures; and 3) alternative pathways (bridging classes) providing a second chance to out-of-school children to enter the formal system. As a result, more than 8,000 children have been reintegrated into the formal system in 2020. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
